N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 2C.113 - DEAF CHILD AREA and BLIND CHILD AREA Signs (NYW7-6, NYW7-7)

State Regulations

Option: 01 The DEAF CHILD AREA (NYW7-6) and BLIND CHILD AREA
(NYW7-7) signs (see Sign Drawing SD-W20) may be used where it is necessary to
warn motorists to be especially alert for a child who may be unable to hear
normal traffic sounds and respond to audio warnings, or a child who may be
unable to perceive approaching traffic. Guidance: 02 The DEAF CHILD AREA and BLIND CHILD AREA signs should
not be used without the consent of the child's parents or legal guardian. The
authority having jurisdiction over the highway on which these signs are placed
should keep informed about the residences, areas of activity, and ages of the
children involved, so that signs can be promptly removed when they are no
longer needed. Notes
